overview: The January 2026 update for GitHub Copilot in Visual Studio introduces colorized code completions, the ability to partially accept completions, various editor productivity improvements, and streamlined Markdown preview controls.

detailed_explanation.title: Colorized code completions
bullets: Code completions now support syntax highlighting to help distinguish variables, functions, and other elements.
The article says this can be enabled in settings via “Use colorized text for code completions.”

detailed_explanation.title: Partial acceptance of completions
bullets: You can accept only part of a suggestion by clicking inside it.
Hovering over the suggestion highlights segments; you can accept up to the cursor position.

detailed_explanation.title: Editor productivity improvements
bullets: The update includes requested improvements such as faster scrolling, HTML-rich copy/paste, and syntactic line compression.
The full list of included improvements is Not stated in the article.

detailed_explanation.title: Markdown preview controls
bullets: Markdown preview controls now support switching between Split Preview, Open Preview, and Edit Markdown modes.
Zoom controls are mentioned as helping with Mermaid diagrams.
Copilot Chat includes a Preview button to render and edit generated markdown content, and this is stated as available in the Stable channel.

detailed_explanation.title: Where to learn more
bullets: The article points to Visual Studio downloads, a Visual Studio blog post, and release notes for details.
It also notes the Insiders channel for the latest updates.

key_changes: Visual Studio Copilot completions can be syntax-highlighted (colorized completions).
Users can partially accept code completion suggestions by clicking within the suggestion.
Markdown preview controls and Copilot Chat’s markdown preview experience were streamlined.
impact: Developers using Copilot in Visual Studio may review and accept suggestions more quickly with syntax-highlighted and partially-accepting completions.
Markdown-heavy workflows (including Mermaid diagrams) may benefit from improved preview/zoom and the Copilot Chat Preview button.
Teams may see incremental productivity gains from the editor improvements described.
caveats: Some features are referenced alongside channel guidance (Insiders vs Stable); exact gating by version/build is Not stated in the article.
Details for the productivity improvements and the precise release/version applicability are Not stated in the article.
insights: The update focuses on usability improvements (readability and fine-grained acceptance) rather than only model changes.
Calling out Stable vs Insiders suggests a gradual rollout path for features and a focus on practical developer ergonomics.
